content:
The IG Publisher doc says:

for each resource in the implementation guide, whether a conformance resource or an example, the IG Publisher will produce:
<snipped out things not relevant to this question />
redirects from /[Type]/[id] to one of the pages above (depending on request format)

This, however, has not been my experience, as http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/us-breastcancer/StructureDefinition/oncology-BreastCancerPresenceStatement goes to a 404 rather than redirecting to http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/us-breastcancer/StructureDefinition-oncology-BreastCancerPresenceStatement.html.

Do I need to do something different? Or is this something that happens when this IG gets published to the canonical URL location (in our case http://hl7.org/fhir/us/breastcancer)?
it's meant to, but it's work in progress. That's what comes of writing the documentation before the code....
but it will only happen at the canonical URL location anyway

OK. This is my first time to this particular rodeo, and I know I've asked you a similar question to this but not exactly this: Will our IG be available at the canonical URL for the ballot? Or does that happen after the ballot? If after, will there be a special ballot URL or do we just need to freeze our IG on build.fhir.org?

the guide will be at http://hl7.org/fhir/us/breastcancer - that's the canonical URL right?
I will generate the content twice, once for http://hl7.org/fhir/us/breastcancer and once for http://hl7.org/fhir/us/breastcancer/2018May. The latter will never be replaced, but the former will be replaced on an ongoing basis as 'latest publication'
and there'll be a directory like this:
Thank you, Grahame. That is extremely helpful.
Is that automatic (or do you automatically do it), @Grahame Grieve? So the IPS IG will be available at http://hl7.org/fhir/ips (once I have the auto-build working correctly)?
ips will be at http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/ips when I publish it. It will be on build.fhir.org in the meantime.
